post_text: A short update on where we stand, "Band-Wise", right now. As you probably know, UIL is allowing for Summer Workouts to begin this week for athletes, provided safety protections are in place. We encourage you to participate in these - it will help when all our seasons (marching band, football, basketball, cross country, etc) start back up. Band is also allowed to begin certain practices this week under safety protocols, but my plan is to wait until our usual time (last week of July) to start Summer Band Practices. I'm hopeful that the safety restrictions will not be quite as strict by then and we can rehearse fairly close to normal. In the mean time, stay safe, and try to get some practice on your instrument. Call or text if you have any questions or would like to check out any music or equipment. Enjoy your summer and we'll see you soon!

Parents and students – VERY IMPORTANT INFORMATION – a new UIL rule states that ALL Marching Band participants must have a physical exam on file prior to starting high school marching band. The rule is the same as applies to athletics – all incoming (next year) 8th, 9th, and 11th graders will have to have a physical. If you are an incoming 10th or 12th grader and had a physical last year, you are ok for the upcoming school year. If you are an incoming 10th or 12th grader and did NOT have a physical last year, or had a significant injury over the past year, you will need to get another physical done.
Irion County will be taking students in for physicals THIS WEDNESDAY, May 1, departing school at 1:00 pm. ALL STUDENTS MUST HAVE A PHYSICAL FORM WITH THEM WEDNESDAY, FILLED OUT AND SIGNED BY PARENT/GUARDIAN. The school will cover the expense of this exam.
Please contact me if you have any questions – thank you!

post_text: Good day at UIL Region Solo/Ensemble contest. Elijah earned a 1 and qualified for State on his memorized Class 1 Marimba solo. Our Sax Quartet (Brad, Natali, Anahi, and Carol) earned a 1 and qualified for State with their performance. Brad and Natali were "double medalists", each earning a 1 on a solo as well. Other medalists for solos include David, Kateri, Amanda, and Alexa. Our Trombone Trio (Riley, Wes, and Jon) were "close but not quite" on their Class 1 Ensemble, earning a 2. Others receiving 2's were Anahi (on a memorized Class 1 solo !) and Carol (freshman playing a Class 1 !). VERY PROUD of all of these kiddos - they are going "above and beyond" to make our Hornet Band even better!

post_text: Our performance of "Ninja!" by Luke McMillan. 1st Division Rating from all three judges. Here's a little perspective for you. Our 1A district turned in an official UIL high school (9-12) enrollment of 83 students. The 56 students in band (grades 8-12) represent over 50% of the student population for those grades. 8 are varsity football players. A dozen are varsity or junior high cheerleaders. Most of the varsity and junior high cross country teams are here. Also students that do one-act play, participate in debate, are involved in 4-H and ag projects. Many have part time jobs. In short - it takes an entire community, a school working together, and most importantly a FANTASTIC group of young people to pull off a performance like this. VERY proud of what these kids have accomplished this year.
